enterText.repeat: You are on the street. The path to Mrs. McGillicutty's house is to the north.  The sidewalk continues to the east.

STREET-02.name: Street

enterText.first: You walk down the street to the Radley House.  To the north is the Radley front porch. You could walk south back to Mrs. McGillicutty's house.
enterText.repeat: You are in front of the Radley House.

STREET-02.lookText: You are in front of the Radley House.

NICE-PORCH.name: Nice Porch

enterText.first: You are standing on Mrs. McGillicutty's porch. The porch light is on, casting a warm welcoming glow. [hint: type -use doorbell- to ring the doorbell]
enterText.second: The porch light is off, but you try the bell anyway. No one answers.
enterText.repeat: The porch light is off. No one answers the door.

NICE-PORCH.lookText: You are on Mrs. McGillicutty's porch.

NICE-HOUSE.name: Nice House

enterText.first:
The door to the nice house swings open.  Mrs. McGillicutty answers. Her face is painted green, and she is wearing a pointy witch hat. 'Elphaba!' you think? She holds a small candy dish, and tells you to take two candies.

After you take the candies she leans over and whispers 'Mr. Radley and his son Aurhur next door are having a scavenger hunt. You might find this note useful during that game!'  She hands you a handwritten note and you put it in your pocket. [hint: use examine note to read it] 'Good luck dear!' she says, and closes the door.
enterText.second: You ring and ring, but no one answers.
enterText.repeat: You ring and ring, but no one answers.

NICE-HOUSE.lookText: You are still on the porch.

FRONT-PORCH.name: Front Porch

enterText.first: You go up the walkway to the front porch of the Radley House.
enterText.repeat: You are on the Radley's front porch.

FRONT-PORCH.lookText: You are on the Radley's front porch.

enterText.first: You enter the Radley House foyer. It reminds you of a scene from that Downton Abbey show...  there are doors everywhere! [hint: type -get ???- to pick up something.]

You enter the library. Wow! Tall bookshelves line the walls, and the floor is covered in a thick carpet.  There are several armchairs scattered around the room.  An open book lies on a table near the window.

enterText.repeat: You are in the dining room.

DINING-ROOM.lookText: You are in the dining room.

enterText.repeat: You are in the game room.

GAME-ROOM.lookText: You are in the game room.

TV-ROOM.name: TV Room

enterText.first: You enter the TV room. A large flat-screen TV mounted on the wall is playing a movie - the classic 1938 screwball comedy 'Bringing Up Baby.' On the screen, Cary Grant and Katharine Hepburn are in the middle of a hilarious scene involving a leopard. Against the opposite wall stands an elegant wooden cabinet with glass doors. Through the glass, you can see shelves lined with DVD cases. Your eyes are drawn to a DVD of 'Bringing Up Baby' on the second shelf. Wait... how is the movie playing if the DVD is right there in the cabinet?
enterText.repeat: You are in the TV room. The movie is still playing on the TV, and the DVD cabinet stands against the wall.

TV-ROOM.lookText: You are in the TV room. A large TV is mounted on one wall, currently playing 'Bringing Up Baby.' An elegant DVD cabinet with glass doors stands against the opposite wall.

HOME.name: Home

enterText.first: You walk home. It's great to be able to rest after all that trick-or-treating.  You pour all your candy out on the dining room table.  What a great haul!  .........  That's about it for this game.  Nothing more to do here.  You might as well choose another mini-game and go have some fun!
enterText.repeat: You are home.  The game is over.  Choose another mini-game.

HOME.lookText: You are home.  The game is over.  Choose another mini-game.
